data.author: usrx201
data.content: Sorry, i meant to cut the top 75% off or prior post. continuing: "Commercial Performance Exact sales data hasn't been released yet (typical for new launches; Frontier often shares after 1-2 weeks). However, proxies suggest a strong start: Steam Concurrent Players: Peaked at ~25,000 in the first day (per SteamDB estimates), comparable to Evolution 2's launch (~30,000) and well above average for the genre. Revenue Estimates: Early projections from tools like Sensor Tower peg first-week gross at $5-8 million on Steam alone, driven by $60 base price and Deluxe Edition upsells (adding species like Protoceratops). No console breakdowns available, but PS5/Xbox digital sales are tracking positively per analyst chatter. Context from Series: The franchise is a Frontier bestseller (Evolution 1 generated ~$26M gross lifetime). Pre-order bonuses (e.g., "Badlands Set") and tie-ins to Jurassic World Dominion lore likely boosted day-one sales. Engagement Metrics: Over 10,000 X posts with #JWE3 since launch, plus active Discord (Frontier Unlocked) for feedback/sharing. YouTube views for trailers/playthroughs exceed 500K in 4 days. Overall, the launch is off to a roaring success—sentiment is the highest in the series, and commercial signals indicate it could match or exceed Evolution 2's ~2M units sold in its first year. Expect official sales announcements soon, potentially in Frontier's next earnings call. If you're a fan, it's a safe buy for sandbox creativity alone."
data.thread_title: RE: Re: JWE3 - "launch is off to a roaring success"

data.author: usrx201
data.content: Launch Overview Jurassic World Evolution 3 released on October 21, 2025, for PC (via Steam), PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S. Just four days into its launch as of October 25, the game has garnered strong initial reception, building on the success of its predecessors (Jurassic World Evolution sold over 3 million copies lifetime, and Evolution 2 achieved 90% positive Steam reviews). Early indicators point to a solid debut, with high player engagement and positive buzz, though specific sales figures are not yet publicly available. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment is overwhelmingly positive, with critics and players praising the game's refinements to park-building mechanics, stunning visuals, and new features like juvenile dinosaurs and in-park breeding. It's frequently called the "best in the series" for addressing past issues like micromanagement and customization limits. On social platforms like X (formerly Twitter), discussions highlight excitement over creative tools, dinosaur realism, and immersive campaigns, though some console players note frustrations with build limits and controls. Critical Reception Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques: Occasional bugs, micromanagement fatigue in late-game, and console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). X (Twitter) Trends: High engagement on #JurassicWorldEvolution3, with users sharing screenshots of baby dinos, terrain edits, and park builds. Posts emphasize "stunning graphics" and "hours of zen," but a minority (e.g., ~10-15% of sampled posts) complain about console performance limits making challenge modes "unbeatable." from ai opinion: "Critical Reception: Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques:  console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment: Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). X (Twitter) Trends: High engagement on #JurassicWorldEvolution3, with users sharing screenshots of baby dinos

At this point in time, Frontier management's best option to stop the share price fall would seem to be to stop  managing, but for the fact I find myself unable to conceive who capable would want the job.

data.author: usrx201
data.content: Sorry, i meant to cut the top 75% off or prior post. continuing: "Commercial Performance Exact sales data hasn't been released yet (typical for new launches; Frontier often shares after 1-2 weeks). However, proxies suggest a strong start: Steam Concurrent Players: Peaked at ~25,000 in the first day (per SteamDB estimates), comparable to Evolution 2's launch (~30,000) and well above average for the genre. Revenue Estimates: Early projections from tools like Sensor Tower peg first-week gross at $5-8 million on Steam alone, driven by $60 base price and Deluxe Edition upsells (adding species like Protoceratops). No console breakdowns available, but PS5/Xbox digital sales are tracking positively per analyst chatter. Context from Series: The franchise is a Frontier bestseller (Evolution 1 generated ~$26M gross lifetime). Pre-order bonuses (e.g., "Badlands Set") and tie-ins to Jurassic World Dominion lore likely boosted day-one sales. Engagement Metrics: Over 10,000 X posts with #JWE3 since launch, plus active Discord (Frontier Unlocked) for feedback/sharing. YouTube views for trailers/playthroughs exceed 500K in 4 days. Overall, the launch is off to a roaring success—sentiment is the highest in the series, and commercial signals indicate it could match or exceed Evolution 2's ~2M units sold in its first year. Expect official sales announcements soon, potentially in Frontier's next earnings call. If you're a fan, it's a safe buy for sandbox creativity alone."
data.thread_title: RE: Re: JWE3 - "launch is off to a roaring success"

data.author: usrx201
data.content: Launch Overview Jurassic World Evolution 3 released on October 21, 2025, for PC (via Steam), PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S. Just four days into its launch as of October 25, the game has garnered strong initial reception, building on the success of its predecessors (Jurassic World Evolution sold over 3 million copies lifetime, and Evolution 2 achieved 90% positive Steam reviews). Early indicators point to a solid debut, with high player engagement and positive buzz, though specific sales figures are not yet publicly available. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment is overwhelmingly positive, with critics and players praising the game's refinements to park-building mechanics, stunning visuals, and new features like juvenile dinosaurs and in-park breeding. It's frequently called the "best in the series" for addressing past issues like micromanagement and customization limits. On social platforms like X (formerly Twitter), discussions highlight excitement over creative tools, dinosaur realism, and immersive campaigns, though some console players note frustrations with build limits and controls. Critical Reception Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques: Occasional bugs, micromanagement fatigue in late-game, and console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). X (Twitter) Trends: High engagement on #JurassicWorldEvolution3, with users sharing screenshots of baby dinos, terrain edits, and park builds. Posts emphasize "stunning graphics" and "hours of zen," but a minority (e.g., ~10-15% of sampled posts) complain about console performance limits making challenge modes "unbeatable." from ai opinion: "Critical Reception: Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques:  console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment: Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). X (Twitter) Trends: High engagement on #JurassicWorldEvolution3, with users sharing screenshots of baby dinos

data.author: usrx201
data.content: Sorry, i meant to cut the top 75% off or prior post. continuing: "Commercial Performance Exact sales data hasn't been released yet (typical for new launches; Frontier often shares after 1-2 weeks). However, proxies suggest a strong start: Steam Concurrent Players: Peaked at ~25,000 in the first day (per SteamDB estimates), comparable to Evolution 2's launch (~30,000) and well above average for the genre. Revenue Estimates: Early projections from tools like Sensor Tower peg first-week gross at $5-8 million on Steam alone, driven by $60 base price and Deluxe Edition upsells (adding species like Protoceratops). No console breakdowns available, but PS5/Xbox digital sales are tracking positively per analyst chatter. Context from Series: The franchise is a Frontier bestseller (Evolution 1 generated ~$26M gross lifetime). Pre-order bonuses (e.g., "Badlands Set") and tie-ins to Jurassic World Dominion lore likely boosted day-one sales. Engagement Metrics: Over 10,000 X posts with #JWE3 since launch, plus active Discord (Frontier Unlocked) for feedback/sharing. YouTube views for trailers/playthroughs exceed 500K in 4 days. Overall, the launch is off to a roaring success—sentiment is the highest in the series, and commercial signals indicate it could match or exceed Evolution 2's ~2M units sold in its first year. Expect official sales announcements soon, potentially in Frontier's next earnings call. If you're a fan, it's a safe buy for sandbox creativity alone."
data.thread_title: RE: Re: JWE3 - "launch is off to a roaring success"

data.author: usrx201
data.content: Launch Overview Jurassic World Evolution 3 released on October 21, 2025, for PC (via Steam), PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S. Just four days into its launch as of October 25, the game has garnered strong initial reception, building on the success of its predecessors (Jurassic World Evolution sold over 3 million copies lifetime, and Evolution 2 achieved 90% positive Steam reviews). Early indicators point to a solid debut, with high player engagement and positive buzz, though specific sales figures are not yet publicly available. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment is overwhelmingly positive, with critics and players praising the game's refinements to park-building mechanics, stunning visuals, and new features like juvenile dinosaurs and in-park breeding. It's frequently called the "best in the series" for addressing past issues like micromanagement and customization limits. On social platforms like X (formerly Twitter), discussions highlight excitement over creative tools, dinosaur realism, and immersive campaigns, though some console players note frustrations with build limits and controls. Critical Reception Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques: Occasional bugs, micromanagement fatigue in late-game, and console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). X (Twitter) Trends: High engagement on #JurassicWorldEvolution3, with users sharing screenshots of baby dinos, terrain edits, and park builds. Posts emphasize "stunning graphics" and "hours of zen," but a minority (e.g., ~10-15% of sampled posts) complain about console performance limits making challenge modes "unbeatable." from ai opinion: "Critical Reception: Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques:  console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment: Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). Option Grants / PDMR Dealings
On 10 February 2026, Frontier Developments plc (AIM: FDEV, 'Frontier', the 'Company', or the 'Group'), a leading developer and publisher of video games based in Cambridge, UK
,
granted a total of 185,000 options over Ordinary Shares of 0.5p each in the Company ('Ordinary Shares') under the existing Long Term Incentive Plan ('LTIP') to three Executive Directors (the 'Options').
The exercise price of the Options under the LTIP is the nominal value of the Ordinary Shares, being 0.5p each. The Options are due to vest on 10 February 2029, with 50% of the Options vesting subject to the achievement of threshold targets for revenue, profit and shareholder return over the three-year vesting period, and the remaining 50% vesting on a straight-line basis against stretch targets for the three performance measures.

Frontier Developments plc is a leading independent developer and publisher of video games, specialising in creative management simulation (CMS) experiences. Headquartered in Cambridge, UK, Frontier develops and nurtures globally successful game franchises, including core CMS franchises such as

Subtract owned from sold gives number returned for refund, 172k.

data.author: Prudent4
data.content: I do believe the market response to today's RNS demonstrates the true extent of what Tempus writing in The Times politely described as Frontier Developments' "big credibility problem". The share price now sits 22% down from the launch of Planet Coaster 2. With Panmure Liberum forecasting an even greater series earnings drop in earnings from the forthcoming FY26 game, one hates to think where that will leave the share price. At this point in time, Frontier management's best option to stop the share price fall would seem to be to stop  managing, but for the fact I find myself unable to conceive who capable would want the job.

data.content: Six weeks of overhead supply from previous trading volume likely to resist above 500. data.author: usrx201
data.content: The SP hit my charting target of 535  and reached initial target predictions  a week before the Plane Zoo 2 official announcement. Now with JWE3 reported already at least $15 million revenue, and projected to be $30 million by end of the year, plus the PZ2 announcement on Nov 5th, the SP could be accumulating flag for now hopefully, then continue on to decide to break above 600 by next year to reach '20-'21 recovery targets eventually above 1k for a positive bull case , if all continues to be positive with no major blunders. JWE3 is a hit, and there's a growing playerbase that are into the creation park aspect of the game seen with all the crazy involved player structure creations shared on the JWE workshop public cloud. It takes the park creation functions of PC and PZ franchises and powered up JWE3 for more of next level from prior JWE2 and JWE. The backlash over Elite Dangerous' 'Dodec' arx product  'pay2win' delving into slippery-slope, implication was quickly backtracked in a day, to make it early access only confirmed. There backlash on mixed reviews on steam and yt, and related discussions, but I'd think it's quickly died down by now, and will be forgotten soon to have little effect, imo it was not a real blow to the regained 'trust' of ED's improvement and +150% in revenue on the ED side of Frontier,  since last year with their early access arx product model. On Oct 31st, JP Morgan Asset Mgmt (UK) increaed their stake of FDEV to 5.09%  ( a stake of $5.4 mil usd) now becoming one of top 5 institiutional holders. "Increased Institutional Confidence: Crossing 5% is a significant threshold — it signals J.P. Morgan views Frontier as a strategic growth holding, especially post the strong Jurassic World Evolution 3 launch and Planet Zoo 2 announcement. Share Price Impact: FDEV shares rose ~3–5% in the days following the November 5 RNS, reflecting positive market sentiment." - gtlah, o7

However, proxies suggest a strong start: Steam Concurrent Players: Peaked at ~25,000 in the first day (per SteamDB estimates), comparable to Evolution 2's launch (~30,000) and well above average for the genre. Revenue Estimates: Early projections from tools like Sensor Tower peg first-week gross at $5-8 million on Steam alone, driven by $60 base price and Deluxe Edition upsells (adding species like Protoceratops). No console breakdowns available, but PS5/Xbox digital sales are tracking positively per analyst chatter. Context from Series: The franchise is a Frontier bestseller (Evolution 1 generated ~$26M gross lifetime). Pre-order bonuses (e.g., "Badlands Set") and tie-ins to Jurassic World Dominion lore likely boosted day-one sales. Engagement Metrics: Over 10,000 X posts with #JWE3 since launch, plus active Discord (Frontier Unlocked) for feedback/sharing. YouTube views for trailers/playthroughs exceed 500K in 4 days. Overall, the launch is off to a roaring success—sentiment is the highest in the series, and commercial signals indicate it could match or exceed Evolution 2's ~2M units sold in its first year. Expect official sales announcements soon, potentially in Frontier's next earnings call. If you're a fan, it's a safe buy for sandbox creativity alone."
data.thread_title: RE: Re: JWE3 - "launch is off to a roaring success"

data.author: usrx201
data.content: Launch Overview Jurassic World Evolution 3 released on October 21, 2025, for PC (via Steam), PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X/S. Just four days into its launch as of October 25, the game has garnered strong initial reception, building on the success of its predecessors (Jurassic World Evolution sold over 3 million copies lifetime, and Evolution 2 achieved 90% positive Steam reviews). Early indicators point to a solid debut, with high player engagement and positive buzz, though specific sales figures are not yet publicly available. Sentiment Analysis Sentiment is overwhelmingly positive, with critics and players praising the game's refinements to park-building mechanics, stunning visuals, and new features like juvenile dinosaurs and in-park breeding. It's frequently called the "best in the series" for addressing past issues like micromanagement and customization limits. On social platforms like X (formerly Twitter), discussions highlight excitement over creative tools, dinosaur realism, and immersive campaigns, though some console players note frustrations with build limits and controls. Critical Reception Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). OpenCritic: 83/100 ("Mighty" rating; top 9% of 2025 games, 89% recommend). Key Praises: Deeper management systems, expressive dinosaurs, global campaign spanning post-Fallen Kingdom lore, and modular building tools. IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game." Key Critiques: Occasional bugs, micromanagement fatigue in late-game, and console-specific issues like sluggish controls. Player Sentiment Steam: 92% positive from 1,850+ reviews (Very Positive; outperforms Evolution's 86% and Evolution 2's 90% lifetime scores). X (Twitter) Trends: High engagement on #JurassicWorldEvolution3, with users sharing screenshots of baby dinos, terrain edits, and park builds. Posts emphasize "stunning graphics" and "hours of zen," but a minority (e.g., ~10-15% of sampled posts) complain about console performance limits making challenge modes "unbeatable." from ai opinion: "Critical Reception: Metacritic: 82/100 (generally favorable; higher than Evolution 2's 79). IGN called it an "incredibly engaging management sim" and a series high point. PCGamesN noted it as "the ultimate Jurassic Park video game."
